alert.note: Alert for Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Chukchi Sea Coast; Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast; Yukon Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 02 at 1:48PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Strong Storms Impacting West Coast of Alaska This Weekend... A strong storm moving north over the Western Bering Sea on Friday will move into the Chukchi Sea on Saturday. This will bring snow, southerly gales and possible blizzard conditions to the West Coast of Alaska Friday night and Saturday. A trailing storm will move north to the Central Bering Sea on Saturday and to the Chukchi Sea on Sunday. This will bring southerly gales with gusts over 70 mph and possible blizzard conditions along the West Coast Saturday into Sunday. Inland areas will see heavy snow along south facing slopes, possible blizzard conditions, and possible freezing rain Saturday night into Monday. There could also be water moving on top of the sea ice along the West Coast Sunday into early next week.
